Generation I.Red: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.
Generation I.Yellow: Adored for their cute looks and playfulness. They are thought to be rare, as they do not appear often.
Generation I.Stadium: Because of its adorable nature, it is in high demand as a pet. However, it is rare and found only in limited areas.

Generation II.Gold: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.
Generation II.Silver: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pok é mon is rarely found.
Generation II.Crystal: Though rarely seen, it becomes easier to spot, for some reason, on the night of a full moon.
Generation II.Stadium 2: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pok é mon is rarely found. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pok é mon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.
Generation III.Sapphire: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pok é mon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.
Generation III.Emerald: On every night of a full moon, they come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy go to sleep nestled up against each other in deep and quiet mountains.
Generation III.FireRed: Its adorable appearance makes it popular as a pet. However, it is rare and difficult to find.
Generation III.LeafGreen: With its magical and cute appeal, it has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

Generation IV.Diamond: Thought to live with others on quiet mountains, it is popular for its adorable nature.
Generation IV.Pearl: It flies using the wings on its back to collect moonlight. This Pokémon is difficult to find.
Generation IV.Platinum: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
Generation IV.HeartGold: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

Generation V.Black: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
Generation V.White: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
Generation V.Black 2: On nights with a full moon, Clefairy gather from all over and dance. Bathing in moonlight makes them float.
Generation V.White 2: On nights with a full moon, Clefairy gather from all over and dance. Bathing in moonlight makes them float.

Generation VI.X: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
Generation VI.Y: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.

Generation VII.Sun: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.
Generation VII.Moon: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Bathed in moonlight, its wings glow faintly. Without even flapping, Clefairy rises into the air, where it dances around.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Adored for their cute looks and playfulness. They are thought to be rare, as they do not appear often.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Adored for their cute looks and playfulness. They are thought to be rare, as they do not appear often.

Generation VIII.Sword: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
Generation VIII.Shield: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Thought to live with others on quiet mountains, it is popular for its adorable nature.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Moonlight gathers on the wings on Clefairy's back, allowing Clefairy to fly. This Pokémon is difficult to find.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: It can be found in quiet mountain areas on a full moon's night. Its dancing and its tiny, faintly glowing wings confer upon it a lovely fairylike quality.

Generation IX.Scarlet: On nights with a full moon, Clefairy gather from all over and dance. Bathing in moonlight makes them float.
Generation IX.Violet: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.
